title: Lovakengj

properties.name: description
properties.value: Lovakengj (pronunciation: /ˌloʊ.və.ˈkeɪn/ "loh-vuh-KAYN") is one of the five cities in the Kingdom of Great Kourend, which resides in a volcanic area exclusively inhabited by dwarves. One of the three cities founded in the history of Great Kourend, Lovakengj was founded by Yonrith Lovakengj,[1] the leader of a dwarven army allied with Saradomin that fought against the Zarosians at Lassar during the God Wars. Today, the city is led by Lady Vulcana Lovakengj of the Lovakengj House.

content:
Lovakengj
Released7 January 2016 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationGreat Kourend
InhabitantsDwarves
TeleportsXeric's talisman (Xeric's Inferno)
MusicDwarven Domain
Map
Advanced data
Typesettlement

Lovakengj (pronunciation: /ˌloʊ.və.ˈkeɪn/ "loh-vuh-KAYN") is one of the five cities in the Kingdom of Great Kourend, which resides in a volcanic area exclusively inhabited by dwarves. One of the three cities founded in the history of Great Kourend, Lovakengj was founded by Yonrith Lovakengj,[1] the leader of a dwarven army allied with Saradomin that fought against the Zarosians at Lassar during the God Wars. Today, the city is led by Lady Vulcana Lovakengj of the Lovakengj House.

As one of the five cities of Great Kourend, the city is responsible for providing military equipment for the Shayzien Army; their main export are ores found by blasting rocks with dynamite in the Blast Mine, in addition to Shayzien supply armour, which is made from lovakite, a unique metal found only within Lovakengj.

Since the establishment of trade routes between Great Kourend and the mainland, Lovakengj has established contact with the Mining Consortium of Keldagrim, though they offer nothing notable to Lovakengj.[2] In the past, the city once had maintained contact with the imcando dwarves in the southern kingdom of Varlamore, who reside in an underground city beneath the Avium Savannah. However, they lost contact with them centuries ago,[3] presumably during the War of the Five Houses.

  • 2 Gaining favour

    • 2.4 Delivering minecart control scrolls

    • 4.1 Sulphur mine
    • 4.2 Lovakite mine
    • 4.3 Lovakengj mine
    • 4.4 Blast mine
  • 5 Shops
  • 6 Personalities
  • 7 Trivia
  • 8 References

Transportation[edit | edit source]

  • Xeric's Talisman - Xeric's Inferno teleport (by the lovakite furnace south of the blast mine)
  • Fairy ring CIS and run West (requires a one time payment of 80.000 coins to Trossa)
  • Kharedst's memoirs or Book of the dead - Jewellery of jubilation teleport (requires completion of The Forsaken Tower)
  • Games Necklace - Wintertodt teleport and run south-west
  • Fairy ring - DJR and run north
  • Lovakengj Minecart Network

Gaining favour[edit | edit source]

Safespot for the sulphur clouds (Must have the spider attacking you otherwise this won't work!) This works similar to Trapping in Thieving. If another player walks under you then you will need to reset the safespot.

Earning favour with Lovakengj requires you to assist in the collecting of resources for blast mining and the creation of armour. Blast mining will allow players to get ores at an accelerated rate, but only if they choose to invest their time with Lovakengj.

To progress in the Architectural Alliance miniquest, players must gain 100% Lovakengj favour and speak to Lovada, who is found in the building just outside the blast mine.

Making dynamite

Dynamite is used in the Lovakengj mining operations. It is created from volcanic sulphur, juniper charcoal, saltpetre and a pot, then using the resulting dynamite pot with a ball of wool. Adding the wool to the dynamite gives 0.1% favour.

To acquire the 20% favour required for The Forsaken Tower quest, you will need to make 153 dynamite. Alternatively, for a more simple method, an average of 606 Volcanic sulphur can be mined. Achieving 30% favour will require 226 dynamite, 301 for 40% favour to be able to complete an elite clue scroll step, and 564 for 75% favour. This can then be raised to 100% by delivering all five minecart control scrolls. Additionally, you may complete The Forsaken Tower (requires completion of Client of Kourend and 20% Lovakengj favour) for another 10% favour, lowering the amount of dynamite required to achieve 100% to 498.

Alternatively, one can mine 3031 sulphur to get from 0% to 100% favour.

Note: All calculations take into account the small amounts of favour gained for mining volcanic sulphur.

Acquiring Volcanic Sulphur

Volcanic sulphur (Level 42 Mining required), is found at the sulphur mine in the north-west part of Lovakengj. A gas mask, face mask or slayer helmet/(i) is required when mining here! If the player is not wearing either of the items, then they are told "You'll choke on the fumes if you try to mine without protection". Each volcanic sulphur mined has a 1 in 3 chance of yielding 0.1% favour. Make sure to bring food when mining large amounts of volcanic sulphur, as the sulphur clouds will still deal rapid damage when nearby, even through a gas mask or face mask. Jugs of wine are an especially cheap method of healing from the damage taken. Note: If you choose to only mine volcanic sulphur to get your Lovakengj favour, you will want to use the safespot and shift/drop. Volcanic sulphur is not a notable item, so they are only droppable manually.

Acquiring Juniper Charcoal

Juniper charcoal is created by adding juniper logs gathered by cutting mature juniper tree (located by the saltpetre mines, and requires 42 Woodcutting to chop) to one of the charcoal burners on the beach next to the bank (max 60 per furnace) then light it and pay Smoggy 600 coins (per furnace) to watch over the process for you. This takes about 16–17 hours, and when it is complete the player will receive 50 charcoal per log they put in the furnace, producing 3,000 juniper charcoal per furnace.

Acquiring Saltpetre

Saltpetre can be purchased in the Grand Exchange relatively cheaply. Otherwise, it is found in the area south of the Hosidius bank, and will spawn in one of five possible locations within the area, and moves once the deposit is depleted. A spade is required to gather saltpetre. A helpful tip is that Konoo, a saltpetre digger, will be located wherever the latest saltpetre deposit is located. It is also a possible reward from Wintertodt and Chambers of Xeric.

Acquiring Other Components

Empty pots can be purchased in bulk in Toothy's Pickaxes, a store next to the bank chest near the sulphur mine. Ball of wool can be purchased in Little Munty's Little Shop, north-east of the southern bank. Alternatively, both of these components can be purchased from the Grand Exchange.

The Forsaken Tower

Once players reach 20% favour, they can start the The Forsaken Tower quest. This quest requires completion of Client of Kourend, and completion of the quest will grant a Lovakengj favour certificate worth 10% favour.

Making Shayzien supply armour

Once players have 30% favour, they will receive permission to mine in the lovakite mine, where lovakite ore can be found. These ores along with 2 coal for each ore, are then smelted in the lovakite furnace, a special furnace south of the Blast Mine (or usage of the Superheat Item spell), making lovakite bars to smith Shayzien supply armour. Players require level 65 (boosts work) in Mining to mine lovakite, and level 45 Smithing to smelt the ore.

Shayzien supply armour packed into a crate gives more favour per bar.

Players can smith various tiers of the supply armour depending on their Smithing level, and turn in the armour pieces to various armourers found throughout Lovakengj. Mining and Smithing experience will also be given as a reward.

However, by smithing a set of supply armour, consisting of a helm, platebody, greaves, gloves, and boots, players will gain larger amounts of favour by packing them into a Shayzien supply crate, found within drawers in the houses of armourers. It takes 11 bars to make one full set of armour.

The tier players are able to smith are dependent on their Smithing level and the amount of favour players have:

  • At 30%, players can smith tier 1 supply armour for the armourer (tier 1). Handing in tier 1 supply crates earns 1.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 1.1% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 53 Smithing.
  • At 40%, players can smith tier 2 supply armour for the armourer (tier 2). Handing in tier 2 supply crates earns 3% favour per crate turned in, instead of 2.2% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 63 Smithing.
  • At 50%, players can smith tier 3 supply armour for the armourer (tier 3). Handing in tier 3 supply crates earns 4.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 3.3% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 73 Smithing.
  • At 60%, players can smith tier 4 supply armour for the armourer (tier 4). Handing in tier 4 supply crates earns 6% favour per crate turned in, instead of 4.4% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 83 Smithing.
  • At 70%, players can smith tier 5 supply armour for the armourer (tier 5). Handing in tier 5 supply crates earns 7.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 5.5% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 93 Smithing.

Up to tier 3, if the player can not smith a full set, still make individual armour pieces from the highest tier possible. With access to tiers 4 and 5, do not make individual armour pieces as the full set from the tier below is always worth more favour per bar used.

With 73 - 82 Smithing, the best method for achieving 30 - 100% favour is to work through the tiers:

  • 30-40% - 7 tier 1 supply crates (77 lovakite ore, 154 coal)
  • 40-50% - 4 tier 2 supply crates (44 lovakite ore, 88 coal)
  • 50-100% - 11 tier 3 supply crates (121 lovakite ore, 242 coal)

This takes a total of 242 lovakite ore and 484 coal.

Delivering minecart control scrolls

Once players reach 65% favour, they may speak to Miriam south of the southern Lovakengj bank to unlock the Lovakengj Minecart Network. Players must deliver five minecart control scrolls to five different locations throughout Great Kourend. Each scroll delivered grants the player 5% favour, with a maximum of 25% available.


Lovakengj benefits[edit | edit source]

  • At 15% favour, players are able to access Thirus Urkar's Fine Dynamite Store, which sells dynamite.
  • At 65% favour, players are able to access the Lovakengj Minecart Network.
  • At 100% favour, players are able to blast rocks in the Blast mine. Players require a chisel, tinderbox, and dynamite in order to blast hard rocks in the mine. The blast mine offers moderate Mining experience per hour and decent money per hour, depending on the player's Mining level.

Features[edit | edit source]

Sulphur mine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Sulphur mine

The Sulphur mine is located in the north-western section of Lovakengj. Volcanic sulphur deposits are found here. Breathing filters like the gas mask or face mask must be equipped to reduce damage taken from toxic gases in the mine.

Lovakite mine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Lovakite mine

The lovakite mine is located south of the sulphur mine and requires at least 30% favour to mine in. It is the only place where lovakite ore can be obtained. A bank can be found within the mine, making it a good place to mine coal.

Lovakengj mine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Lovakengj mine

The Lovakengj mine is a small mine found north-west of the southern bank. Four iron rocks, six coal rocks, and one mithril rock can be found here.

Blast mine[edit | edit source]

Main article: Blast mine

The blast mine is a large mine that can only be used once players have 100% favour. It is run by operators who clean the player's blasted ore, returning ore based on the player's Mining level.

Shops[edit | edit source]

  • Thirus Urkar's Fine Dynamite Store
  • Toothy's Pickaxes
  • Little Munty's Little Shop
  • The Deeper Lode

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Armourer (tier 1)
  • Armourer (tier 2)
  • Armourer (tier 3)
  • Armourer (tier 4)
  • Armourer (tier 5)
  • Fuggy
  • Lovada
  • Mine supervisor
  • Miriam
  • Munty
  • Operator
  • Toothy
  • Thirus

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Lovakengj was named by Mod Reach "emulating what the Dungeoneering boss team did" by whacking the keyboard and making a pronouncable name, then afterwards adding the letter J because "Why not?"[4]
  • Burning Man is an annual event held in the Nevada desert. The fire pit is a reference to the Darvaza gas crater in Turkmenistan.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 23 - "Transcript:Spooky Mahjarrat, Cabbage Mages, and Spots (A Good Boy!)", 6, by Lady Vulcana Lovakengj. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "Oh, Yonrith Lovakengj? He was our founder, you know. He was a great military commander, or so the story goes. Not much talent in Smithing though."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 23 - "Transcript:Spooky Mahjarrat, Cabbage Mages, and Spots (A Good Boy!)", 6, by Lady Vulcana Lovakengj. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "Yes, we are in contact with the Mining Consortium. They don’t have anything to offer us that we don’t make here in Lovakengj."
  3. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 23 - "Transcript:Spooky Mahjarrat, Cabbage Mages, and Spots (A Good Boy!)", 6, by Lady Vulcana Lovakengj. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "There are a few other dwarves in Varlamore, but we haven’t been in contact for centuries, on account of all the assassinations and wars and such."
  4. ↑ Dan. Origin of the name Lovakengj. 29 January 2020.*

[[File:Lovakengj symbol.png|left|120px]]
'''Lovakengj''' (pronunciation: [[wikipedia:WP:IPA for English|/ˌloʊ.və.ˈkeɪn/]] ''"loh-vuh-KAYN"'') is one of the five cities in the Kingdom of [[Great Kourend]], which resides in a volcanic area exclusively inhabited by [[dwarves]]. One of the three cities founded in the history of Great Kourend, Lovakengj was founded by [[Yonrith Lovakengj]],{{CitePostbag|issue=23|author=[[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]]|letter=6|quote=Oh, Yonrith Lovakengj? He was our founder, you know. He was a great military commander, or so the story goes. Not much talent in Smithing though.}} the leader of a dwarven army allied with [[Saradomin]] that fought against the [[Zaros]]ians at [[Lassar]] during the [[God Wars]]. Today, the city is led by [[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]] of the Lovakengj House.

As one of the five cities of Great Kourend, the city is responsible for providing military equipment for the [[Shayzien Army]]; their main export are ores found by blasting rocks with [[dynamite]] in the [[Blast Mine]], in addition to [[Shayzien supply armour]], which is made from [[lovakite bar|lovakite]], a unique metal found only within Lovakengj.

Since the establishment of trade routes between Great Kourend and the mainland, Lovakengj has established contact with the [[Consortium|Mining Consortium]] of [[Keldagrim]], though they offer nothing notable to Lovakengj.{{CitePostbag|issue=23|author=[[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]]|letter=6|quote=Yes, we are in contact with the Mining Consortium. They don’t have anything to offer us that we don’t make here in Lovakengj.}} In the past, the city once had maintained contact with the [[imcando dwarves]] in the southern kingdom of [[Varlamore]], who reside in an underground city beneath the [[Avium Savannah]]. However, they lost contact with them centuries ago,{{CitePostbag|issue=23|author=[[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]]|letter=6|quote=There are a few other dwarves in Varlamore, but we haven’t been in contact for centuries, on account of all the assassinations and wars and such.}} presumably during the [[War of the Five Houses]].

==Transportation==
*[[Xeric's Talisman]] - Xeric's Inferno teleport (by the [[lovakite furnace]] south of the blast mine)
*[[Fairy ring]] {{Fairycode|CIS}} and run West (requires a one time payment of 80.000 coins to [[Trossa]])
*[[Kharedst's memoirs]] or [[Book of the dead]] - [[Jewellery of jubilation]] teleport (requires completion of [[The Forsaken Tower]])
*[[Games Necklace]] - Wintertodt teleport and run south-west
*[[Fairy ring]] - {{Fairycode|DJR}} and run north
*[[Lovakengj Minecart Network]]

==Gaining favour==
<onlyinclude>
[[File:Lovakengj Sulfur Mining Safespot.gif|alt=|thumb|Safespot for the sulphur clouds (Must have the spider attacking you otherwise this won't work!) This works similar to Trapping in Thieving. If another player walks under you then you will need to reset the safespot.]]
Earning favour with Lovakengj requires you to assist in the collecting of resources for blast mining and the creation of [[shayzien supply armour|armour]]. Blast mining will allow players to get ores at an accelerated rate, but only if they choose to invest their time with Lovakengj.

To progress in the [[Architectural Alliance]] [[miniquest]], players must gain 100% Lovakengj favour and speak to [[Lovada]], who is found in the building just outside the [[blast mine]].

<includeonly>==</includeonly>===Making dynamite===<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[File:Dynamite detail.png|right|200px]]
[[Dynamite]] is used in the Lovakengj mining operations. It is created from [[volcanic sulphur]], [[juniper charcoal]], [[saltpetre]] and a [[pot]], then using the resulting [[dynamite pot]] with a [[ball of wool]]. Adding the wool to the dynamite gives 0.1% favour.

To acquire the '''20%''' favour required for [[The Forsaken Tower]] quest, you will need to make '''153''' dynamite. Alternatively, for a more simple method, an average of '''606''' [[Volcanic sulphur]] can be mined. Achieving '''30%''' favour will require '''226''' dynamite, '''301''' for '''40%''' favour to be able to complete an [[elite clue scroll]] step, and '''564''' for '''75%''' favour. This can then be raised to 100% by delivering all five [[minecart control scroll]]s. Additionally, you may complete [[The Forsaken Tower]] (requires completion of [[Client of Kourend]] and 20% Lovakengj favour) for another 10% favour, lowering the amount of dynamite required to achieve 100% to 498.

Alternatively, one can mine 3031 sulphur to get from 0% to 100% favour.

'''Note''': All calculations take into account the small amounts of favour gained for mining volcanic sulphur.

<includeonly>==</includeonly>====Acquiring Volcanic Sulphur====<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[Volcanic sulphur]] (Level 42 [[Mining]] required), is found at the [[sulphur mine]] in the north-west part of Lovakengj. '''A [[gas mask]], [[face mask]] or [[slayer helmet]]/[[Slayer helmet (i)|(i)]] is required when mining here!''' If the player is not wearing either of the items, then they are told "You'll choke on the fumes if you try to mine without protection". Each volcanic sulphur mined has a 1 in 3 chance of yielding 0.1% favour. Make sure to bring food when mining large amounts of volcanic sulphur, as the sulphur clouds will still deal rapid damage when nearby, even through a gas mask or face mask. [[Jug of wine|Jugs of wine]] are an especially cheap method of healing from the damage taken. '''Note''': If you choose to only mine volcanic sulphur to get your Lovakengj favour, you will want to use the safespot and shift/drop. [[Volcanic sulphur]] is not a notable item, so they are only droppable manually.
<includeonly>==</includeonly>====Acquiring Juniper Charcoal====<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[Juniper charcoal]] is created by adding [[juniper logs]] gathered by cutting mature juniper tree (located by the saltpetre mines, and requires 42 [[Woodcutting]] to chop) to one of the charcoal burners on the beach next to the bank (max 60 per furnace) then light it and pay [[Smoggy]] 600 [[coins]] (per furnace) to watch over the process for you. This takes about 16–17 hours, and when it is complete the player will receive 50 charcoal per log they put in the furnace, producing 3,000 juniper charcoal per furnace.
<includeonly>==</includeonly>====Acquiring Saltpetre====<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[Saltpetre]] can be purchased in the Grand Exchange relatively cheaply. Otherwise, it is found in the area south of the [[Hosidius]] bank, and will spawn in one of five possible locations within the area, and moves once the deposit is depleted. A [[spade]] is required to gather saltpetre. A helpful tip is that [[Konoo]], a saltpetre digger, will be located wherever the latest saltpetre deposit is located. It is also a possible reward from [[Wintertodt]] and [[Chambers of Xeric]].
<includeonly>==</includeonly>====Acquiring Other Components====<includeonly>==</includeonly>
Empty pots can be purchased in bulk in [[Toothy's Pickaxes]], a store next to the bank chest near the sulphur mine. [[Ball of wool]] can be purchased in [[Little Munty's Little Shop]], north-east of the southern bank. Alternatively, both of these components can be purchased from the [[Grand Exchange]].

<includeonly>==</includeonly>===The Forsaken Tower===<includeonly>==</includeonly>
Once players reach 20% favour, they can start the [[The Forsaken Tower]] quest. This quest requires completion of [[Client of Kourend]], and completion of the quest will grant a [[Lovakengj favour certificate]] worth 10% favour.

<includeonly>==</includeonly>===Making Shayzien supply armour===<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[File:Lovakite_bar_detail.png|left|138x138px]]
Once players have 30% favour, they will receive permission to mine in the [[lovakite mine]], where [[lovakite ore]] can be found. These ores along with 2 [[coal]] for each ore, are then smelted in the [[lovakite furnace]], a special furnace south of the [[Blast Mine]] (or usage of the [[Superheat Item]] spell), making [[lovakite bar]]s to smith [[Shayzien supply armour]]. Players require level 65 (boosts work) in [[Mining]] to mine lovakite, and level 45 [[Smithing]] to smelt the ore.
[[File:Shayzien_supply_set_(1)_detail.png|thumb|163x163px|Shayzien supply armour packed into a crate gives more favour per bar.]]
Players can smith various tiers of the supply armour depending on their Smithing level, and turn in the armour pieces to various armourers found throughout Lovakengj. Mining and Smithing experience will also be given as a reward.

However, by smithing a set of supply armour, consisting of a helm, platebody, greaves, gloves, and boots, players will gain larger amounts of favour by packing them into a [[Shayzien supply crate]], found within drawers in the houses of armourers. It takes 11 bars to make one full set of armour.

The tier players are able to smith are dependent on their Smithing level and the amount of favour players have:

*At 30%, players can smith tier 1 supply armour for the [[armourer (tier 1)]]. Handing in [[Shayzien supply set (1)|tier 1 supply crates]] earns 1.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 1.1% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 53 [[Smithing]].
*At 40%, players can smith tier 2 supply armour for the [[armourer (tier 2)]]. Handing in [[Shayzien supply set (2)|tier 2 supply crates]] earns 3% favour per crate turned in, instead of 2.2% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 63 [[Smithing]].
*At 50%, players can smith tier 3 supply armour for the [[armourer (tier 3)]]. Handing in [[Shayzien supply set (3)|tier 3 supply crates]] earns 4.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 3.3% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 73 [[Smithing]].
*At 60%, players can smith tier 4 supply armour for the [[armourer (tier 4)]]. Handing in [[Shayzien supply set (4)|tier 4 supply crates]] earns 6% favour per crate turned in, instead of 4.4% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 83 [[Smithing]].
*At 70%, players can smith tier 5 supply armour for the [[armourer (tier 5)]]. Handing in [[Shayzien supply set (5)|tier 5 supply crates]] earns 7.5% favour per crate turned in, instead of 5.5% for all individual pieces. Full set requires 93 [[Smithing]].

Up to tier 3, if the player can not smith a full set, still make individual armour pieces from the highest tier possible. With access to tiers 4 and 5, do not make individual armour pieces as the full set from the tier below is always worth more favour per bar used.

With 73 - 82 [[Smithing]], the best method for achieving 30 - 100% favour is to work through the tiers:

* 30-40% - 7 [[Shayzien supply set (1)|tier 1 supply crates]] (77 [[lovakite ore]], 154 [[coal]])
* 40-50% - 4 [[Shayzien supply set (2)|tier 2 supply crates]] (44 [[lovakite ore]], 88 [[coal]])
* 50-100% - 11  [[Shayzien supply set (3)|tier 3 supply crates]] (121 [[lovakite ore]], 242 [[coal]])

This takes a total of 242  [[lovakite ore]] and 484 [[coal]].

<includeonly>==</includeonly>===Delivering minecart control scrolls===<includeonly>==</includeonly>
[[File:Miriam_chathead.png|left]]
Once players reach 65% favour, they may speak to [[Miriam]] south of the southern Lovakengj bank to unlock the [[Lovakengj Minecart Network]]. Players must deliver five [[minecart control scroll]]s to five different locations throughout [[Great Kourend]]. Each scroll delivered grants the player 5% favour, with a maximum of 25% available.
</onlyinclude>

==Lovakengj benefits==

*At 15% favour, players are able to access [[Thirus Urkar's Fine Dynamite Store]], which sells [[dynamite]].
*At 65% favour, players are able to access the [[Lovakengj Minecart Network]].
*At 100% favour, players are able to blast rocks in the [[Blast mine]]. Players require a [[chisel]], [[tinderbox]], and [[dynamite]] in order to blast hard rocks in the mine. The blast mine offers moderate [[Mining]] experience per hour and decent money per hour, depending on the player's Mining level.

==Features==
===Sulphur mine===
{{main|Sulphur mine}}

The Sulphur mine is located in the north-western section of Lovakengj. Volcanic sulphur deposits are found here. Breathing filters like the gas mask or face mask must be equipped to reduce damage taken from toxic gases in the mine.

===Lovakite mine===
{{main|Lovakite mine}}
The lovakite mine is located south of the sulphur mine and requires at least 30% favour to mine in. It is the only place where [[lovakite ore]] can be obtained. A bank can be found within the mine, making it a good place to mine coal.

===Lovakengj mine===
{{main|Lovakengj mine}}

The Lovakengj mine is a small mine found north-west of the southern bank. Four [[iron rock]]s, six [[coal rock]]s, and one [[mithril rock]] can be found here.

===Blast mine===
{{main|Blast mine}}

The blast mine is a large mine that can only be used once players have 100% favour. It is run by [[operator]]s who clean the player's [[blasted ore]], returning ore based on the player's Mining level.

==Trivia==
*Lovakengj was named by Mod Reach "emulating what the Dungeoneering boss team did" by whacking the keyboard and making a pronouncable name, then afterwards adding the letter J because "Why not?"{{CiteGeneral|url=https://clips.twitch.tv/ImpartialTolerantWhaleDAESuppy|title=Origin of the name Lovakengj|author=Dan|date=29 January 2020}}
*{{Wp|Burning Man}} is an annual event held in the Nevada desert. The fire pit is a reference to the Darvaza gas crater in Turkmenistan.
